reconciliation.resolution: CNN's structured (20,2) input + conv1d bias extracts signal invisible to flattened MLP

limitations.description: All data is from 2022 — a bear market with aggressive Fed rate hikes. Microstructure patterns may be regime-specific. R1 showed quarter-level reversals across all metrics.

R3 CNN tested only return_5 (h=5, ~25s). CNN performance at h=1 is unknown. The architecture recommendation rests on h=5 signal that R2/R4 found negative with simpler models. Must test CNN at h=1 in model build.
With 5 folds x ~84k bars and R²<0.007, the 95% CI on any gap overlaps zero for effect sizes < ~0.003 R² units. Cannot detect small-but-real gaps.
No regime-conditional analysis performed in R2-R4. R1 showed effect reversal across quarters. Architecture decision may not hold across regimes.
R2 Δ_spatial raw p=0.025 → corrected p=0.96. R3 CNN vs MLP corrected p=0.251. These are suggestive but inconclusive after multiple comparison correction.
R3 CNN fold R² ranges from 0.049 to 0.180 (std=0.048). High variance across folds suggests regime sensitivity even within the single year.

spatial_cnn.r3_evidence: CNN R²=0.132, p=0.042 vs Attention, d=1.86

open_questions: Oracle expectancy from Phase 3 C++ backtest
CNN performance at h=1 (R3 only tested h=5)
Transaction cost estimation for R²=0.005-0.132 signals
CNN embedding + GBT integration architecture details
